National_Security_Danger: Potential danger to national security, though allegations have weakened
Threat_Assessment: Reasonable grounds to believe Mr. Mahjoub posed a threat were previously established
Risk_Factor: Compliance with conditions and diminished credibility of allegations reduce current risk
Admission_or_Involvement: Alleged involvement in activities threatening national security
Individual_Behavior: Mr. Mahjoub has complied with release conditions
Evidence_Type: Expert reports, legal arguments, compliance records
Key_Evidence_Issue: Weakened allegations and lack of current credible evidence
Evidence_Credibility: Credibility of the allegations against Mr. Mahjoub has diminished
Credibility_Factors: Compliance with conditions, length of time, lack of new evidence
Credibility_Assessment: The court found the ongoing stringent conditions no longer justified
Evidence_Issues: Reliance on outdated or uncorroborated intelligence
Standard_of_Proof: Reasonable grounds to believe under IRPA s.82(5)
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s.82(5)
Legal_Standard: Proportionality and constitutionality of release conditions
Decision_Outcome: Conditions reduced; less restrictive measures ordered
Process: Judicial review of security certificate conditions
Procedural_Element: Review of evidence and legal arguments by Federal Court
Procedural_Issue: Proportionality and Charter compliance of imposed conditions
Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Alleged violation of Charter rights due to excessive restrictions
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness and proportionality under Charter scrutiny
Review_Standard: Judicial review of administrative decision under IRPA
Detention_Factors: Threat assessment, compliance history, duration of monitoring
